newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia, China securities regulators sign pact.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia, China securities regulators sign pact.

text.p: Securities regulators from Malaysia and China have signed a pact for international cooperation between their watchdog organisations, Malaysia's Securities Commission (SC) said on Saturday.

In a statement, the SC said the memorandum of understanding, signed with the China Securities Regulatory Commission on Friday in Beijing, sets up a framework for "the provision of assistance, exchange of information and mutual investigative assistance" between the two bodies.

SC chairman Munir Majid said the agreement was signed in anticipation of cross-border investor needs. "We as regulators must work together to ensure that there are sufficient safeguards for these investments," he said in the statement.

Zhou Daojiong, chairman of China's securities regulator, said China hoped to benefit from the exchange of information and cooperation with fellow regulators as it standardises the way it regulates its securities and futures market.
No mention was made in the statement about possible listings of Chinese firms on the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange. Officials at the SC could not be reached for further comment on Saturday.
